Description: Body fragment of an Attic black-figured pottery olpe or oinochoe; most of horse-rider to right; added red face and chiton; red on horse's neck.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Roemer and Pelizaeus Museum, Hildesheim. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.1231)
Kreuzer 2011 / Griechische, ptolemäische und römische Keramik im Roemer- und Pelizaeus-Museum Hildesheim (p. 29 no. 26, pl. 16)
